chatParticipants.name: datannur

languageModelTools.name: datannur_execute_sql
languageModelTools.modelDescription: ⚠️ CRITICAL: NEVER answer questions about data from memory. ALWAYS call this tool first to get EXACT values from the database. Execute SQL SELECT queries on the data catalog database. Use for: filtering (WHERE), counting (COUNT), aggregating (GROUP BY), joining tables, or any analytical query. Always use LOWER() for case-insensitive text matching. Columns ending with '_id' are foreign keys. Columns ending with '_ids' contain comma-separated IDs (use LIKE '%value%'). Available tables: institution, dataset, variable, doc, folder, tag, modality, freq, evolution, value. Parameter: sql (string) - A valid SQLite SELECT query. Example: SELECT * FROM institution WHERE id = 'ofs-tourisme' to get exact parent_id value.

languageModelTools.name: datannur_search
languageModelTools.modelDescription: ⚠️ CRITICAL: NEVER answer questions about data from memory. ALWAYS call this tool first to verify what exists in the database. Search for text across ALL database tables simultaneously. Use when you don't know which table contains the data, or for general exploration by name/description. Returns matching records from multiple tables. Do NOT use for queries by ID (use SQL instead). Parameter: query (string) - Text to search for across all tables. Example: query 'tourisme' to find all tourism-related records.
